![v2hSwFD.png](http://i.imgur.com/v2hSwFD.png)

So, basically, Post-Humanity theory is where the universe dies, humanity is almost killed but gets transformed into a new species entirely, and now they forgot everything they had learned and achieved and must now rediscover themselves if they want to survive on by escaping the universe itself before the exploding stars wipe them out.

What is your theory trying to explain? What was your original hypotheses[is]. How could this be tested?

Also, could this theory explain why I'm still awake, because I wanna go sweeeeeep.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-25T06:17:35Z" title="06/25/2015 06:17  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 25, 2015</time> by NFUN**
This is not a theory. This is fiction.

1) The timeline of this game.

2) The universe has already ended, and, scrounging up all the remaining little resoruces they had, they start over and explore space. Thus, KSP is really only Humanity trying to restart itself and escape the universe.

3) The planets are small, and the sun is a very bizarre red dwarf due to the artificial fusion machine.

Not really fiction, it would explain the oddities of KSP.

- - - Updated - - -

Ok yes, it's fiction, but it would explain both the past, present and future of KSP's universe.
What you said makes much more sense in context, though I'm not sure it is *quite* the right explanation.
Moving this to Fan Works, the place for fiction about the KSP Universe.
Yay, you came back at almost no provocation! But seriously, welcome back.

How could you simultaneously use resources from the planets to fuel the sun and make the cores denser? That matter would have to come from somewhere. Besides, I don't think the quantities would be more than a drop in the bucket for a star.
